messageBody:
Carfield Yim wrote:
>
> Not sure if
> http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/System.html#setIn
> <http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/System.html#setIn>(java.io.InputStream)useful
> in your test

That's what I came here to say. It should work; I've done the same thing
with System.out. I assume that you know what kind of input is expected
by the code.

> On 6/21/07, Monika <monika.uni@... <mailto:monika.uni%40arcor.de>>
> wrote:
> >
> > I write JUnit tests for classes that were not written by me. If one of
> > these classes happens to include reading from System.in, Eclipse will
> > just hang up and I have to kill it.
> >
> > How can I simulate input on System.in in my test case so that the test
> > could succeed?
> >
> > If this is not possible, how can I make it throw an exception instead
> > of hanging up, so that the test case will just fail?
> >
> > TIA,
> > Monika.
